item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for June 11, 2024
item.description:
Strands is a short daily puzzle game with a deceptively simple premise: find eight hidden words inside a letter jumble. But unlike other word jumbles, you will not know the words you need to find ahead of time. Also, you need to use every letter without overlapping any. And on top of that, the theme for today's words is pretty challenging.

If you already know the rules of how to play Strands but are still struggling, this article is for you. In here, you can find spoiler-free hints, word spoilers, an explanation for the puzzle, and even the whole answer if you would like to see it.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #100 for June 11, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue Hold Up... There are eight items to find: one Spangram and seven themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you want to see a hint or two that doesn't spoil any of the words in the puzzle, like the in-game hint system does in this browser-based game, you can find three hints below. Each one is nestled in an expandable section, covered up so you don't have to see it if you don't want to.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

If it would be more helpful to see a couple of the spoilers for this New York Times Games puzzle, you can find two word spoilers below. Each expandable section only has one word and its position in the grid inside.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

The full answer, including the words' positions in the grid, are in the expandable section below. Press the Read More button to see the whole thing.

Today's Strands Explained

Today's challenging puzzle might be a little confusing. If you are looking for a full explanation, you can see it all laid out in the expandable section below.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: MultiVersus: Rift Cauldron, Explained
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is The Rift Cauldron In MultiVersus?
  • What Does Rift Cauldron Do?

MultiVersus puts you in an exciting universe featuring most of the nostalgic Warner Bros exclusive heroes and characters, teeming with exciting challenges and rewards. Among those rewards is the Rift Cauldron, which is tricky to get as it contains a series of objectives you need to complete.

Given its tricky nature, the reward it offers at the end of completion is worth a try. Many players are unsure how to acquire and use the Rift Cauldron in MultiVersus . This guide is here to answer all your questions about this reward in the game.

What Is The Rift Cauldron In MultiVersus?

A Rift Cauldron is one of the rewarding milestones for players, which they can unlock by completing a few unique in-game challenges. These missions are designed to help players familiarize themselves with the game mechanics. Luckily, completing these challenges also rewards you with experience points and fighter currency.

How To Unlock The Rift Cauldron

To get a Rift Cauldron in MultiVersus, you'll need to complete all Rift Challenges and collect 100 Stars in PvE mode. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to do it:

  • From your home screen, select Enter Rifts and choose a campaign, like MultiVersal Mayhem , or whatever suits you.
  • To keep things nice and easy, you can set the difficulty level to Easy .
  • Each node offers five different challenges with specific conditions. Some of them involve battles against iconic characters such as the Joker, while others might focus on environmental challenges like shooting hot air balloons or more.
  • As you progress through these challenges, you will notice your milestone bar filling up. To complete the milestone, you will need to collect a total of 100 stars . It means you will have to complete at least 80% of the total objective to complete this challenge.

What Does Rift Cauldron Do?

After completing the Rift challenge in the game, you can claim the rewards by selecting the Claim button next to Collect Rift Cauldron, present in your match-up summary. Once you have claimed the Rift Cauldron, you will get the following rewards:

  • 200 XP : Experience points are crucial if you want to increase your character level in MultiVersus. With XP, you can power up any character, making them stronger and capable in battles.
  • 250 Fighter Currency : With this currency, you can buy new characters for your team. This will not only increase your roster in MultiVersus but also let you try out their unique combat styles and skills specific to each character.

item.title: Hogwarts Legacy: Every Broom, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players can upgrade their brooms at Albie Weekes' shop in Hogsmeade for better performance in Hogwarts Legacy.
  • Five basic brooms can be purchased for 600 galleons each, but the best-looking brooms are unlocked through challenges.
  • The Summer Update added two new brooms, Lavender Borealis and Dark Lightning, enhancing gameplay in Hogwarts Legacy.

Broom flight is one of the best things about the Harry Potter universe, and it gets no better than in Hogwarts Legacy where players can traverse the entire map on their trusty old brooms. While all the brooms in Hogwarts Legacy have the same stats, they will all benefit from Albie Weekes' innovative upgrades. Mr. Weekes can be found in Hogsmeade at his shop Spintwitches Sporting Needs and players can take part in broom time trials to unlock these upgrades.

At Spintwitches, players will also have a choice of five different brooms all for 600 galleons each, but these are fairly basic and far from the best models. To get their hands on the best-looking brooms in the game and fly around the Scottish Highlands in style, players can complete the Pop Balloons challenges or find Wandering Merchants and spend their hard-earned galleons.

Updated on June 10th, 2024, by Joe Grantham:​ The brooms in Hogwarts Legacy are naturally some of the most sought-after items in the game, with fans eager to get their hands on the best and fastest. Furthermore, as exciting as other mounts like Hippogriffs and Thestrals are, the flexibility of the broom makes it easily the best mount in Hogwarts Legacy, especially when fully upgraded by Albie Weekes. With the release of the Summer Update, players now have access to two new brooms in Hogwarts Legacy , the Lavender Borealis Broom and the Dark Lightning Broom. This is this first time new brooms have been added to the game, taking the total to 15 now, and with that, those two new brooms have been added to this list.

15 Moon Trimmer Broom

Safe Family Traveling Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

600 Galleons

Bought from Spintwitches Sporting Needs in Hogsmeade

The Moon Trimmer Broom is one of the five basic brooms available from Albie Weekes for a cheap price, but it is arguably the worst-looking broomstick in the game. With a fairly rudimentary lantern hanging from the handle and nondescript saddlebags on either side of the seat, this broom is built for purpose, not style.

The broom also appears to be second-hand with its previous owner not taking great care of it, and even for 600 Galleons, players can pick up better options.

14 Yew Weaver Broom

Family Traveling ​​​Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

600 Galleons

Bought from Spintwitches Sporting Needs in Hogsmeade

While the performance of each broomstick in Hogwarts Legacy is no different from any other, players certainly won't feel all that speedy on the chunky Yew Weaver Broom . The broom's tail is rather large and while this might offer stability and power, it's hard to imagine it helping with aerodynamics.

However, if players feel this is the broom for them, then thankfully, it can be picked up fairly early on in the game in Hogsmeade at Spintwitches Sporting Needs, along with four other options.

13 Lickety Swift Broom

Fancy Traveling Broomstick

Cost

How To Unlock

Free

Pop 7 sets of balloons while on a broom (Pop Balloons Exploration Challenge)

With its padded leather seat and charming basket, the Lickety Swift Broom is certainly built for comfort and would be ideal for an aged witch living in a rural village. While this might not be the aesthetic that most adventure seekers are looking for, it might just very well fill a niche for certain roleplayers in Hogwarts Legacy .

The Lickety Swift Broom appears to be in pretty good condition and can be picked up for free by merely completing the second tier of the Pop Balloons challenge.

12 Hogwarts House Broom

Quidditch Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

600 Galleons

Bought from Spintwitches Sporting Needs in Hogsmeade

The Hogwarts House Broom is the only broom in the game that changes its appearance based on which House the player is in. This means that on second, third, or even fourth playthroughs, players will see different versions of the broom. Outside of this feature, it is far from the best-looking broom, but nonetheless, a solid first option that lets players show off their House pride. Players can also show off their Hogwarts House pride with their Room of Requirement design.

This broom, which looks like it has seen better days, and may have been used by many previous students, is one of the five starter brooms that can be purchased from Spintwitches Sporting Needs. Players will only need to spend 600 galleons to purchase this broom.

11 Ember Dash Broom

Adventurer's Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

600 Galleons

Bought from Spintwitches Sporting Needs in Hogsmeade

Despite being one of the starter brooms, purchasable from Spintwitches Sporting Needs for just 600 galleons, the Ember Dash Broom has a surprisingly interesting design. Naturally, the main point of focus is the tail which is on fire and actually has some great effects mid-flight. There is also a slight heat haze seen around it.

When compared with the other broom to have a fiery tail, the Wild Fire Broom, players will notice that the Ember Dash is much sleeker with a smooth aerodynamic handle that looks ideal for racing.

10 Aeromancer Broom

Traveling Potioneer's Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

3000 Galleons

Bought from Rohan Prakash near Maraunweem Bridge or Cragcroftshire

Outside the context of the Harry Potter universe, when the image of a witch is conjured it usually includes an old broomstick and a bubbling cauldron full of potions. Thankfully for those wishing to recreate this iconic aesthetic within Hogwarts Legacy , the Aeromancer Broom exists.

This wizened old broom with a small cauldron hooked to the handle, can be purchased for 3000 galleons from the Wandering Merchant Rohan Prakash. Mr. Prakash can be found near the Marunweem Bridge as well as in Cragcroftshire.

9 Wild Fire Broom

Adventurer's Broomstick

Cost

How To Unlock

Free

Pop 17 sets of balloons while on a broom (Pop Balloons Exploration Challenge)

As the in-game description puts it, the Wild Fire Broom captures an untamed nature. This is easy to understand when looking at the gnarled and knotted handle, which is only outshone by the fiery and ember-filled tail. This tail comes with its own effects, which are similar but slightly better than those of the Ember Dash Broom.

To get hold of the Wild Fire Broom players will have to complete Tier III of the Pop Balloons challenge, which means they will need to pop a further ten sets of balloons after already popping seven sets as part of the previous tiers.

8 Wind Wisp Broom

Safe Traveling Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

600 Galleons

Bought from Spintwitches Sporting Needs in Hogsmeade

Out of the five brooms that can be bought for 600 galleons from Spintwitches Sporting Needs, the Wind Wisp Broom is perhaps the most simple, but also the most stylish and unique. As the smallest broom in the game, it is perfect for maintaining a low profile.

It is also a highly practical broom due to the small lantern hanging from the front, making nighttime flights a tad safer. While this broom might look out of place on Imelda Reyes' racecourses, it is a great first broom, especially for the price.

7 Bright Spark Broom

Nighttime Traveler's Broomstick

Cost

How To Unlock

Free

Pop 32 sets of balloons while on a broom (Pop Balloons Exploration Challenge)

The Bright Spark Broom is arguably the hardest broom to acquire as players will need to pop every single ballon set in the game, however, if they manage to find them all, it won't cost them a single galleon. The first thing players will notice about this broom are the two stars dangling from the handle, a feature that may put some off this otherwise stylish broom.

The unique angled shape of the tail also catches the eye and fits in perfectly with the metal-adorned seat and handle. One of the best things about the Bright Spark Broom and one of the many small details that make Hogwarts Legacy so beautiful is that a trail of small stars can be seen flowing out the back of the broom in flight. This is particularly visible at night.

6 Family Antique Broom

Everyday Use Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

2500 Galleons

Bought from Priya Treadwell, south of Hogwarts

With a wild tail of untended twigs and a handle that appears to have been snapped off a tree, the Family Antique Broom might not be for everyone, but for those looking to complete their rustic 19th-century aesthetic, it is beyond perfect.

Its natural design, or in fact lack of design, might not fit in on the Quidditch pitch, but it looks great when roaming the rugged countryside. This treasured family heirloom can be bought for 2500 galleons from the Wandering Merchant, Priya Treadwell south of Hogwarts, who players might recall as the wife of historian Nora Treadwell.

5 Night Dancer Broom

Fancy Traveling Broomstick

Cost

How To Unlock

Free

Pop 2 sets of balloons while on a broom (Pop Balloons Exploration Challenge)

For the sleekest broom in all of Hogwarts Legacy , look no further than the Night Dancer Broom , which would look at home even on a modern Quidditch pitch. Its tail is banded in silver for both style and speed, and the slim and straight handle gives it a professional feel. The only downside is that the broom is fairly small, especially when compared with the Silver Arrow Broom.

The best thing about the Night Dancer Broom is that it is free and extremely easy to unlock. Players simply have to pop two sets of balloons, which they will have to do anyway as part of Madam Kogawa's assignment. Just remember to actually unlock it on the Challenges page once complete.

4 Lavender Borealis Broom

A Stylish Traveling Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

Free

Automatically available as part of the 2024 Summer Update

As part of the Summer Update for 2024, there are two new brooms in Hogwarts Legacy , and the Lavender Borealis Broom is free to all players and will be waiting in their inventory when they next boot up the game.

This beautifully crafted broom is said to glide on the wind like rivers of light in the twilit northern sky, which is likely in reference to the lavender trail it leaves in its wake. Its blue handle is similar to the color of the Beauxbaton uniforms seen in the Goblet of Fire , making it one of the most elegant brooms in the game.

3 Dark Lightning Broom

A Broomstick For Dark Wizards & Witches

Cost

Where To Find

2000

Bought from Spintwitches Sporting Needs in Hogsmeade

A few brooms have trail effects, but none are quite as vibrant as the Dark Lightning Broom , with the two colors of purple and black seemingly fighting for space behind it. The effect is in fact reminiscent of the trail that Dark wizards and witches leave behind when apparating, and it is for these individuals that this sleek broom has been designed.

It costs 2000 galleons to purchase the Dark Lightning Broom from Spintwitches Sporting Needs in Hogsmeade, although it only appears to be accessible at certain later stages of the game, with some players reporting they cannot find it right out of the gate.

2 Sky Scythe Broom

Quidditch & Racing Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

5000 Galleons

Bought from Leopolde Babcocke, north of Hogwarts

The Sky Scythe Broom is the most luxurious broomstick in the game and its green twigged tail makes it perfect for those looking to show off their Slytherin pride. Unlike other brooms, the Sky Scythe's seat and handle are both intricately designed, with the latter ending in a stylish flourish.

Priced at 5000 galleons it is the joint most expensive broom in Hogwarts Legacy and can be purchased from the Wandering Merchant Leopolde Babcocke, who can be found at various locations north of Hogwarts.

1 Silver Arrow Broom

Quidditch Broomstick

Cost

Where To Find

5000 Galleons

Bought from Arn the Goblin in Lower Hogsfield after completing Carted Away

As Hogwarts Legacy is set around a century before the events of the main Harry Potter series, by which time broom craft had become more refined, there is only one broom that diehard book fans will recognize. The Silver Arrow Broom is the broom that Madam Hooch learned to fly on, and it is easy to imagine many Quidditch players of the era making a name for themselves atop this impressive broom.

The silver metal and light-colored tail add a professional element to the broom and the spike would certainly deter the opposing player from getting too close. To get their hands on Leonard Jewkes' famous design, players will not only have to fork out 5000 galleons but also complete a side quest. By helping out the goblin Arn in the Carted Away quest, they will then have the option to purchase the broom from him in Lower Hogsfield.

item.title: XDefiant Reveals New Faction, Maps, Mode, and More Coming in Season 1
item.description:
Highlights

  • Ubisoft's XDefiant Season 1 will introduce a new faction, maps, weapons, Ranked Play, and Capture the Flag game mode on July 2.
  • XDefiant has seen massive success with over 500,000 players on launch day, with issues like hit registration having been fixed in updates.
  • For a head start before Season 1, players can purchase the Founder's Pack for bonus content or subscribe to Ubisoft+ Premium for immediate access.

Ubisoft revealed a new faction, multiple maps, a new mode, and much more coming in Season 1 of XDefiant , Ubisoft's new free-to-play first-person shooter. XDefiant has been a major success for Ubisoft so far, and the game's first season looks to add content that fans have been wanting since last month's launch.

More than 500,000 concurrent XDefiant players were present on launch day, and three million players were active in the first 48 hours of launch. It was also Ubisoft's fastest game to reach one million players in less than three hours. Although XDefiant broke launch records for Ubisoft, the discussion surrounding the state of the game is contested due to lingering issues and bugs. XDefiant's first major update fixed some of these issues, including problems with hit registration, and reactivated the Practice Zone game mode. More fixes and updates are expected to arrive before the launch of Season 1 later this summer.

During the June 10 Ubisoft Forward event, Ubisoft confirmed XDefiant Season 1 begins on July 2 and introduces a new faction: the GSK. Alongside the new GSK faction, XDefiant Season 1 will introduce three new maps over the course of three months: Daytona, Clubhouse, and Rockefeller. What's more, three new weapons will be added to XDefiant for free, Ranked Play will make its full debut, and Capture the Flag will be added to the game's playlist. This new content was teased in the Season 1 reveal trailer, but more details will come shortly before the season begins.

XDefiant Season 1 Announced at Ubisoft Forward

  • Launching July 2
    • New GSK faction
    • New Daytona, Clubhouse, and Rockefeller maps
    • Three new weapons
    • Ranked Play and Ranked Progression
    • Capture the Flag game mode
    • New Battle Pass and features

  • Full reveal happening on July 2 in new XDebrief episode

Ubisoft confirmed that the full reveal for XDefiant Season 1 will happen on July 1 during an episode of "XDebrief" on Ubisoft's official YouTube channel. The XDebrief episode will unveil new features, the Season 1 Battle Pass, and much more coming to XDefiant throughout the month of July and beyond. Further, the developers previously confirmed that a killcam feature and Search and Destroy-like mode are coming to XDefiant , so more information on these new additions may come in the near future.

XDefiant is currently in its Preseason, and Ubisoft is expected to release several more fixes leading into the launch of Season 1. These updates could address some of XDefiant's missing features, improve the game's weapon balancing, and further enhance the state of the game.

Before Season 1 launches, players may get a head start by purchasing the XDefiant Founder's Pack, which unlocks the DedSec faction for all characters and bonus cosmetics like the Game Over legendary skins. Those subscribed to Ubisoft+ Premium gain immediate access to new factions and bonus cosmetics as well.

item.title: Dark and Darker Mobile Hands-On Preview
item.description:
Highlights

  • Dark and Darker Mobile is a PvPvE fantasy dungeon-crawling battle royale game inspired by popular titles like Fortnite and PUBG.
  • The game features five distinct classes: Fighter, Barbarian, Ranger, Rogue, and Cleric.
  • Despite being a touch-screen game, Dark and Darker Mobile offers smooth controls and a non "pay-to-win" model, making it enjoyable for free-to-play gamers.

To be completely honest, traveling to South Korea from the States to visit Krafton (the publisher behind PUBG and Dark and Darker ) to play a touch-screen-controlled mobile version of a PC game was not on my bingo card. I typically stay away from hardcore online multiplayer titles, especially ones played on a smartphone. Still, after spending some quality time with Bluehole Studio's Dark and Darker Mobile , I'm a believer --you can color me impressed.

Dark and Darker is a PvPvE (players versus players versus enemy) fantasy dungeon-crawling battle royale. Its genre titling may be a mouthful, but there's no other way to describe it. Heavily inspired by 'damaging closing circle' battle royale games like Fortnite and PUBG , D&D Mobile players have to delve into dark and dangerous dungeons to try and grab as much loot from treasure chests as they can while making sure they "extract" at the right time without losing to the effects of the "Darkswarm." And while this is happening, other real players will be around, ready to attack anyone in the way. Of course, strong monsters are all around the maps, too, causing even more chaos.

Right now, there are five distinct classes for players to choose from in Dark and Darker Mobile . There's the Fighter, who carries a shield to deflect enemy attacks; the Barbarian can hold powerful two-handed weapons and can perform a spinning move, dealing damage to anyone in its path; the Ranger is great at dishing out damage to foes at a distance, using a bow and arrow to defend themselves; then there's the Rogue, who uses stealth and poison to get what they want; to wrap it up, the Cleric works more like a support class, healing allies and doing more damage to Undead enemies.

I found myself enjoying the Fighter class the most, as it offered a versatile skill set and could get me out of most sticky situations.

Being a touch-screen game, one might think a hardcore fantasy extraction battle royale could be difficult to control, but Bluehole Studio has done a pretty standup job converting the PC experience and optimizing it for smartphones. Moving around, tapping to open treasure chests, and even attacking enemies feels good --not once did I think the game would be more enjoyable on a PC or traditional console.

With how easy it was to join other players in the lobby and connect, I could see Dark and Darker Mobile being a hit with the free-to-play crowd. Bluehole mentioned in our interview that they do not intend the game to be "pay-to-win" --they just want players to have fun with friends and not worry about paying a ton of real-world money to catch up with others. And from the time spent playing this with other people in the same room as me, the energy in the air was positive. We were all communicating to talk strategy, shouting if a formidable enemy spawned in or if someone was down and needed a revive. It could get pretty intense because if you fail the extraction and fall prey to the closing circle or just a dumb monster, you lose all of your equipment and treasure --and yes, we mean all of it.

The game will be nice to players and hand you some starter equipment to hold you over if you have nothing left after a match, but it won't help in the long run, so buying or finding better weapons and equipment is paramount to success in Dark and Darker Mobile . It can sometimes feel like the world is against you if you manage to die repeatedly, but once you get the hang of things and get help from friends, it can be a little easier, especially if you stick to the beginner maps and grind for a little before getting smacked by the late-level maps.

It'll be interesting to see how the mobile audience vibes with Dark and Darker Mobile . From what we've played, it seems like a title that could do well, but if it ends up being an experience where people need to pay to get ahead, it could also be a massive dud. The dev team will have to carefully straddle the line of making the game enjoyable and fun for free-to-play users while also making sure the paid extra content is worthwhile while not giving those same significant advantages.

You can check out our interview with the producer on Dark and Darker Mobile below.

Game Rant was provided travel accommodations for this preview.
